Class ResistorCalculator

Namespace
CircuitTool
Assembly
CircuitTool.dll

Provides methods for resistor calculations, including Ohm's Law, series, and parallel combinations.

public static class ResistorCalculator
Inheritance
object
ResistorCalculator
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)

object.ToString()

Remarks

Example usage:

double r = ResistorCalculator.Resistance(10, 2); // 5 Ohms
double series = ResistorCalculator.Series(10, 20, 30); // 60 Ohms
double parallel = ResistorCalculator.Parallel(10, 20); // 6.67 Ohms

Parallel(params double[])

Calculates total resistance for resistors in parallel: 1/Rtotal = 1/R1 + 1/R2 + ...

public static double Parallel(params double[] resistors)

Parameters

resistors double[]

Resistor values in ohms (Ω).

Returns

double

Total parallel resistance in ohms (Ω).

Examples

double total = ResistorCalculator.Parallel(10, 20); // 6.67 Ohms

Resistance(double, double)

Calculates resistance using Ohm's Law: R = V / I.

public static double Resistance(double voltage, double current)

Parameters

voltage double

Voltage in volts (V).

current double

Current in amperes (A).

Returns

double

Resistance in ohms (Ω).

Examples

double r = ResistorCalculator.Resistance(10, 2); // 5 Ohms

Series(params double[])

Calculates total resistance for resistors in series: Rtotal = R1 + R2 + ...

Parameters

Resistor values in ohms (Ω).

Returns

double

Total series resistance in ohms (Ω).

Examples
